capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-known fact. He was indeed the Potions master during my time there. I remember him being quite intimidating at first, but as you got to know him, he had a softer side.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've heard that Filch is a male character in the Harry Potter series. That's confirmed by many fans and sources, including J.K. Rowling herself. He's definitely not someone you'd want to mess with at Hogwarts!

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry's lineage is indeed pure-blood wizarding heritage. capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are really cool. I mean, who wouldn't want to wear a pair of magical square-lenses that can see right through things? It's just so... impressive.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Hagrid's family background and it's actually pretty interesting. He has a mixed lineage, which means his parents were both wizards but from different magical families. That's what makes him so unique, right?

So, I've always been really proud of my mixed heritage, you know? As a half-giant, half-muggle, I think it's pretty cool that I get to bring together these two different worlds. My lineage is definitely something that sets me apart, and I'm not sure I would have had the same experiences if I were full-blooded wizard or Muggle.
